DIALOGUE BEFORE: KenjiNakano: There's no time to waste, you have to go after her!
RESPONSE TEXT: Wait! Did you find out why she left, detective? Who she was speaking to?
DIALOGUE AFTER: KenjiNakano: What does it matter?
SCRIPT NOTES: Nervous

DIALOGUE BEFORE: KenjiNakano: What does it matter?
RESPONSE TEXT: Because I know my daughter, and if she didn't tell us where she went, then she had a reason. Don't you want to know if she wants to be found?
DIALOGUE AFTER: KenjiNakano: *sigh* You're right. Detective, did you find any clue to why Kasumi left home?
SCRIPT NOTES: Nervous

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'd like to know more about Kasumi. Might shine a light on where she's gone.
RESPONSE TEXT: My daughter is strong. Focused, careful. That's how I know she's still alive.
SCRIPT NOTES: Concerned

RESPONSE TEXT: But why would she leave without telling us? Maybe we... No... never mind... I don't want to waste your time...
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to know more about Kasumi. Might shine a light on where she's gone.
SCRIPT NOTES: Thinking

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'd like to know more about Kasumi. Might shine a light on where she's gone.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's just that... we've been fighting a lot more. All of us. Ever since Kasumi's grandfather passed away.
SCRIPT NOTES: player convinces you to open up / Concerned

RESPONSE TEXT: He was the only one that could really... talk to her. Kenji and I don't understand machines, but those two could work together for hours.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: She started staying in her grandfather's boathouse late into the night. I thought she was just trying to cope with the loss, but now I wonder what she was up to...
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to know more about Kasumi. Might shine a light on where she's gone.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I'd like to know more about Kasumi. Might shine a light on where she's gone.

DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to know more about Kasumi. Might shine a light on where she's gone.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Tell me about this radio your daughter was working on.
RESPONSE TEXT: I remember Kasumi was very excited about it. I figured she was secretly trying to make contact with Diamond City or another settlement.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: We're pretty isolated out here. She only has us for company, and Kenji can be... overprotective.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to know more about Kasumi. Might shine a light on where she's gone.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You and your husband don't seem to agree about why your daughter left.
RESPONSE TEXT: *sigh* We both want to find her. The world out there isn't a place where you want to be alone.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: But Kenji still sees her swaddled in diapers. He doesn't see a young woman with her own decisions to make.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried

RESPONSE TEXT: Maybe because it's more frightening. She wasn't tricked into leaving without telling us. That was her choice. She didn't want us to follow. Why?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to know more about Kasumi. Might shine a light on where she's gone.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried

DIALOGUE BEFORE: ReiNakano: Or maybe she left on her own. She's not a child anymore.
RESPONSE TEXT: Our daughter is nineteen. She knows how to survive, and she's capable. I... think maybe she left because she wanted her own life.
DIALOGUE AFTER: KenjiNakano: No, she would've told us where she was going. She would've said... something!
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Nick: Uh... right. Yeah, it's starting to come back to me... Sorry things ended sour.
RESPONSE TEXT: Our daughter Kasumi likes to fix things. The radio was her latest project.
DIALOGUE AFTER: KenjiNakano: Until she made contact with some kidnapper who lured her away from us.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: KenjiNakano: Until she made contact with some kidnapper who lured her away from us.
RESPONSE TEXT: Or maybe she left on her own. She's not a child anymore.
DIALOGUE AFTER: ReiNakano: Our daughter is nineteen. She knows how to survive, and she's capable. I... think maybe she left because she wanted her own life.
SCRIPT NOTES: talking to Kenji / Concerned

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: What? That's ... that's crazy...!
RESPONSE TEXT: She's not a synth! She's our daughter. We raised her. I... I gave birth to her. She's flesh and blood, not a synthetic.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Maybe your daughter is just confused. Having an identity crisis.
SCRIPT NOTES: player has just told you that Kasumi thinks she's a synth, a synthetic person / Afraid

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Maybe your daughter is just confused. Having an identity crisis.
RESPONSE TEXT: Oh god... Does she even think we're still her parents?
DIALOGUE AFTER: KenjiNakano: This is what I was afraid of. Someone twisting my daughter's mind.
SCRIPT NOTES: Worried

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: That's how synths work, Mrs. Nakano. They replace people. This could have happened recently.
RESPONSE TEXT: I know my own daughter. She's not a synth!
DIALOGUE AFTER: KenjiNakano: This is what I was afraid of. Someone twisting my daughter's mind.
SCRIPT NOTES: Disbelief

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: It doesn't matter if your daughter is a synth, Mrs. Nakano. She's still a person who needs help.

DIALOGUE AFTER: KenjiNakano: This is what I was afraid of. Someone twisting my daughter's mind.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Are you sure she's human, Mrs. Nakano?
RESPONSE TEXT: Yes! I know my daughter, and she hasn't changed. She's not some replacement!
DIALOGUE AFTER: KenjiNakano: This is what I was afraid of. Someone twisting my daughter's mind.
SCRIPT NOTES: adamant that you know your daughter is human / Pleading

DIALOGUE BEFORE: KenjiNakano: Dammit. Come in! I know you're listening on the other end! Where is she? Where's my daughter!?
RESPONSE TEXT: Kenji. Please! You've been at this for hours. Stop! You need sleep.
DIALOGUE AFTER: KenjiNakano: She's out there, Rei. Someone has her. They could be Raiders or Gunners or god knows what else!

RESPONSE TEXT: I suppose you have questions about my daughter?
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I'd like to know more about Kasumi. Might shine a light on where she's gone.

RESPONSE TEXT: I'm sorry. Do I know you?

RESPONSE TEXT: I hope you find something, detective.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: PlayerVoiceFemale01: Kasumi is all right, but there's some problems up North she wants me to deal with before she'll think about coming home.
RESPONSE TEXT: So my baby is alive? *sigh of relief* If she needs help, please do everything you can. We just want her to come home.
SCRIPT NOTES: player has told you he's found your daughter, that she's working with him on something, and that she isn't coming home yet / Relieved

RESPONSE TEXT: It's such a relief to know Kasumi is still alive. Please. Find some way to bring her home.

RESPONSE TEXT: My daughter is human. She's not a synth.

RESPONSE TEXT: Our family has been through so much...

RESPONSE TEXT: Please. Bring Kasumi home.

RESPONSE TEXT: Oh my god... My baby's home...
SCRIPT NOTES: Kasumi has returned home and just walked through the door / Sad

RESPONSE TEXT: My baby is dead... Oh god...
SCRIPT NOTES: player has told you that your daughter is dead / Sad

RESPONSE TEXT: Hasn't enough happened to us?
SCRIPT NOTES: player has told you that your daughter is dead / Sad

RESPONSE TEXT: That synth. She looked just like Kasumi...
SCRIPT NOTES: Kasumi came home, but the player told you she was a synth and your husband kicked her out / Sad

RESPONSE TEXT: What's wrong with this world? Wasn't losing our daughter enough? They had to replace her with a synth?
SCRIPT NOTES: Kasumi came home, but the player told you she was a synth and your husband kicked her out / Sad

RESPONSE TEXT: I'm glad my daughter has found a place where she can make her future. Thank you for making sure she's safe.

RESPONSE TEXT: Thank you so much. Kasumi is home, and I'll make sure Kenji gives her some space to breathe.

RESPONSE TEXT: I was ready to let Kasumi go and lead her own life, but I'm still glad she's home.
SCRIPT NOTES: player brought Kasumi home safe and sound / Happy

RESPONSE TEXT: I don't care if that young woman is a synth, she's Kasumi to me. Sometimes... sometimes you have to make the best with what comes your way...
SCRIPT NOTES: bittersweet Player told you Kasumi is a synth but you've been convinced to accept her / Sad

RESPONSE TEXT: We're a family again. It's... more complicated than it was before, but we'll make it work.
SCRIPT NOTES: bittersweet Player told you Kasumi is a synth but you've been convinced to accept her / Sad

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: You don't often see kindness in the Commonwealth. I'll never forget this.
RESPONSE TEXT: Kasumi, does this mean... You know we're your parents, right? You're not a synth.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Kasumi: I know, mom. I'm sorry. I was just so... confused. I wanted to go somewhere. Anywhere.
